<div class="tourbrd">
<h1>Kailash Mansarovar Yatra from Nepalgunj</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/kailash-mansarovar-yatra" title="Kailash Mansarovar">Kailash Mansarovar</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Kailash Mansarovar Yatra from Nepalgunj</span></span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c32797bc1d6_04459623" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">
<div id="tourflexBox2" class="cmsmasters_row_outer_parent">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/kailash-mansarovar-tour.jpg" alt="Kailash Mansarovar Tour Package" title="Kailash Mansarovar Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>The path to God-realization melts away one’s sense of ‘I’, ego-consciousness, to enable one being an empty receptacle to receive the Divine. Whereas arduous treks to summits and inaccessible regions inflate one’s sense of self by adding to it the honor of accomplishment, pilgrimages that are equally difficult to endure intend to wither away one’s egoic self, thereby taking the human soul closer to its impregnation by the Divine. Few pilgrimage trajectories in the modern age carry with them the hallmark of being ‘arduous’, and of the ones that still do, Kailash Mansarovar Yatra from Nepalgunj is deemed the most holy.</p>
<p>Mount Kailash is considered to be the abode of Lord Shiva, the primordial persona of Divine Masculine, whose witness consciousness pervades the entirety of cosmos, which in itself is a playground for Shakti, the Divine Feminine, to engage in her manifold manifestations of Maya. Namaste India Trip Pvt. Ltd brings to you the best and most well-tailored itinerary to encompass the sanctity of Kailash Yatra in 10 days and 9 nights.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Kailash Mansarovar Yatra from Nepalgunj Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Arrive Lucknow - Nepalgunj (185.5 km / 4h 6min)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>Nepalgunj can be reached via a flight from Lucknow Airport. Alternatively, one may travel 3.5 hours via Deluxe AC coach train to reach the destination. One will be warmly ushered into the hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Nepalgunj - Simikot (216 km)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>We will fly to Simikot by an early morning flight from Nepalgunj domestic airport. The day is freed of other strenuous activities to enable one’s being acclimatized to its climate. A visit to the nearby Shiva temple and an excursion around Simikot forms part of the itinerary for the day.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Simikot - Hilsa - Purang (621 km)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After one enjoys a delicious breakfast, it is time to be heli-lifted and transferred to Hilsa by chartered Helicopter. We will then have you cross River Karnali to reach Sher followed by one hour drive to Purang. One has to finish the immigration formalities and then relax and rewind at the hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Purang</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Exploring the Purang city and its market forms the crux of the day’s itinerary. The day will help one be acclimatized to the region’s climate.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Purang - Mansarovar (4580m)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>An hour-long drive will take one to Lake Manasarovar. The parikrama or circumambulation of the Lake follows. After performing the blessed pooja and holy dip in the Mansarovar Lake, one may leave for Chiu Gompa where provision for an overnight stay has been duly arranged.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Mansarovar - Darchen</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The morning itinerary again makes time to enable the holy dip, Homan and holy puja at the Mansarovar Lake. One hour drive after the lunch takes one to Darchen. The rest of the day is kept free.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Darchen - Driaphuk (4890m)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>One is ushered in for an early morning drive to Yam Dwar. Herein begins the first day of the trek of Kailash Yatra. The 13 km long trek can take around 6-7 hours. There is provision to ride on a personal horse at the juncture.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Driaphuk - Zuthulphuk (4790m)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The trek to Pass Dolma, situated at a height of 5,670 m above sea level, begins early in the morning. The region is known for its unpredictable weather. Snowstorms are frequently reported. The parikrama gifts one the beautiful panorama of Gauri Kund and Ganesh Kund.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Zuthulphuk - Hilsa - Simikot</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The ninth day requires one to trek for 2-3 hours to finish the Kora (parikrama) at Mani wall of Mt. Kailash. Congratulations on having completed the sacred parikrama! One may then proceed to Purang and then to Tibet, followed by the drive till Hilsa. One will be airlifted to Simikot for an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 10 :</span>Simikot - Nepalgunj</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>One will be received at the Nepalgunj Airport, and then transferred to Lucknow, of course after enjoying their refreshments at the hotel in Nepalgunj.</p>
<p>All the rates are payable via net, including the taxes and service charges.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Kailash Mansarovar Yatra from Nepalgunj</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Are The Kailash Mansarovar Yatra Rules?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> One must be between the ages of 18 and 70 to participate in the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Body Mass Index (BMI) of 27 or less is required. Both physically and mentally fit. The applicant must not be suffering from any serious medical conditions such as high blood pressure, asthma, heart disease, diabetes, and so on.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Best Season To Visit Mount Kailash?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The best time to visit Mt. Kailash is between April and June, and from mid-September to early October, when you can avoid the rainy season and muddy roads. During other times of the year, the entire terrain would be covered in thick snow, making it unsuitable for sightseeing or Kora.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Makes Mansarovar Unique?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> In The Kailash Range, considered one of the most sacred by Hindus, is said to be 30 million years old and formed during the early stages of the Himalayan mountain formation. Its highest peak, the 6,675-meter-high Kailash, is said to be Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati's holy residence.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What City Is Closest To Mansarovar?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Mansarovar is a colony in the Indian state of Rajasthan, located in the city of Jaipur.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Airport Is The Closest To Mansarovar?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> There are no major international airports in the immediate vicinity. Ngari Gunsa Airport is the closest airport, but it only connects to Kashgar in China via China Eastern Airlines, Lhasa in Tibet via Tibet Airlines, and Kashgar and Ürümqi in China's Xinjiang region via Lucky Air.</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
